name: Chris Haversam
descriptions: Chris Haversam is an engineer living in the REPCONN test site in 2281.

Chris Haversam grew up in Vault 34 and was assigned as the vault reactor engineer due to his technical aptitude (and preference for machines that don't shoot people, which made him a preferred pick over fellow engineers Houser and Mitchell.) He believed the radiation he would absorb from his many visits to the vault reactor would turn him into a ghoul, although most of the management dismissed his claims as neurotic.

Eventually, his hair began falling out due to natural reasons, but Chris insisted he was becoming a ghoul due to radiation from the Vault reactor and subsequently left the Vault. The vault descended into chaos shortly after his departure, when the reactor became unstable and began leaking dangerous radiation, turning most of the residents into actual ghouls.
Believing himself to be a ghoul, Haversam joined the Bright Brotherhood in 2279.
Come Fly With Me: Chris sends the Courier to find Isotope-239 igniting agent and thrust control modules so the ghouls' rockets can take off.

The player character can convince Chris that he is indeed human with a Speech check (50) or with the Black Widow perk, and the rest of the Bright Brotherhood needs to leave him behind. The Courier is given the choice to help him sabotage the rockets so the ghouls die in flight. Alternatively, they can convince Chris not to sabotage the rockets, and he will send them off with no hard feelings before heading for Novac.

topics.response_text: Let's hope you do.
Hurry up.
Like I said, find the metal staircase in the big room on the east side of the building. It's where they used to make rockets.
Who I am doesn't matter, smoothskin. Stop wasting time and get up here.

topics.topic: ChrisHavLabBetraySabotageNoThe PC talks Chris out of sabotage
topics.topic_text: That'd be murder, Chris. And you're no murderer.
topics.response_text: What, you think I'm too stupid to pull it off? I know enough to get their rockets working, don't I? So I can make them fail, too!

topics.topic_text: Come to think of it, sabotage is a great idea.
topics.response_text: Then bring me Sugar Bombs. Three boxes should do the trick. Add those to the fuel mixture and "Boom!"
I said I need three boxes of Sugar Bombs, not less than three.

topics.topic: ChrisHavLabGetFuelPC offers to find fuel for rockets
topics.topic_text: I'll track down the igniting agent.
topics.response_text: Very well. We don't need a huge amount. Two to three liters should be enough.

topics.topic: ChrisHavLabGetPartsI'll try to find the parts you need.
topics.topic_text: I'll track down the thrust control modules.
topics.response_text: All right. Anything else?
All right. I'll be here, obviously.
Quiet.

topics.topic: ChrisHavLabHaveFuelPC Turns in jar of atomic fuel
topics.topic_text: I found an entire container of the igniting agent.
topics.response_text: Yes, that's the stuff. And the container's shielding must be intact, or you'd be dead by now.

topics.topic: ChrisHavLabHaveFuelSouvenirPC hands over one or more souvenirs
topics.topic_text: What about this rocket souvenir? The stuff inside glows.
topics.response_text: Yes, that's Isotope-239, all right. And there's enough here to launch the rockets.

topics.topic_text: I found the thrust control modules.
topics.response_text: Indeed you did. And they seem to be in excellent condition.

topics.topic_text: What's the deal with all the rockets down here?
topics.response_text: That's none of your business, smoothskin!
All right. Go on.

topics.topic_text: You're pathetic. No wonder they're leaving you behind.
topics.response_text: Leave me alone! Everyone else does!

topics.topic: ChrisHavLabReadyToHelpPC says he wants to help
topics.response_text: To sabotage the rockets, I'll still need a quantity of the igniting agent.

topics.topic_text: That's everything, right? Let the "Great Journey" begin.
topics.response_text: Yes, that's everything. I'll tell Jason the rockets are ready. It's time to get this over with.

topics.topic: ChrisHavLabTaskChangePC asks for help with different task
topics.topic_text: Actually, I'd like to help with something else.
topics.response_text: All right. What would you rather be doing?

topics.topic_text: Can you give me any tips for my current task?
topics.response_text: REPCONN has been ransacked so many times by scavengers, it's hard to know where the components might turn up. IF they turn up.

topics.topic: ChrisHavLabTaskSamePC will keep working on current task
topics.topic_text: I'll stick with my current task.
topics.response_text: All right. Carry on.

topics.topic_text: So the "Great Journey" will use those rockets?
topics.response_text: Obviously. It's taken months, but I've nearly got them in working order. Soon they'll take us to the Far Beyond.
I'm the flock's resident engineer. I've always been good with machines. Jason says the Great Journey would've been impossible without me.
You bastard! Those ghouls declared me a Saint!

topics.topic_text: It was some sort of mechanical failure.
topics.response_text: I suppose there was always that risk. It's just that Jason was so certain...
What?{shocked to hear Jason call him human}
The rockets are ready, Jason. The Great Journey can begin. Good luck, I guess.
Stay away from me.
Your pranks won't work on me, smoothskin. They won't work on Jason, either.
Jason is the prophet. The only reason you're up here is because he wants to talk to you.
Welcome to Novac. It's not very exciting here, but the people are friendly enough.
Do you think that men go bald normally? I am sick, and I have embraced my change. Leave me be.
The great one can be found upstairs. Don't think about wasting his time. He's very important. You should feel lucky to be granted some of his time.

topics.topic_text: Nevermind, I'll go looking for your components.
topics.response_text: Hurry back. Never have we been so close.

topics.topic_text: Can the launch wait a few minutes?
topics.response_text: Very few. Time is wasting. Hurry back so we can begin.
Goodbye, thank you.

conversation.response_text: Hey Jason, your rockets are ready!
